messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a house with 21 rooms. Room 1 is connected to rooms 21, 5, 24, 9, 4, and 13. Room 2 is connected to rooms 22, 6, 10, 11, 7, and 14. Room 3 is connected to rooms 35, 41, 23, 12, 8, and 20. Room 4 is connected to rooms 13, 21, 5, 24, and 9. Room 5 is connected to rooms 24, 9, 13, and 21. Room 6 is connected to rooms 24, 10, 11, 7, and 14. Room 7 is connected to rooms 14, 22, 10, and 11. Room 8 is connected to rooms 20, 35, 41, 23, and 12. Room 9 is connected to rooms 13, 21, and 41. Room 10 is connected to rooms 11, 14, and 22. Room 11 is connected to rooms 14 and 22. Room 12 is connected to rooms 20, 35, 41, and 23. Room 13 is connected to rooms 21, and 24. Room 14 is connected to rooms 22. Room 20 is connected to rooms 35, 41, and 23. Room 21 is connected to room 24. Room 22 is connected to room 23. Room 23 is connected to rooms 35. Room 35 is connected to room 41. You have been told that there is a reward of 10 for visiting room 22. You have been told that room 6 is now connected to room 22. From room 24, what is the path that yields the most reward? Please list the room numbers in order, separated by commas.

For example the user inputs "1,2,3"
The answer would be: 1,2,3,2,6,23,8,14,13,11,2122,14,23,12,23,35,41
The AI will store the information inside a String variable that can change but the user should detect that when they find a new room that wasn't in the previous String they should take the string back, please avoid iterating an infinite number of times.
I know something like this could be made via brute force but I am here to see if it could be done eloquently "the pythonic" way and if possible putting it back to the user. Afaik is there no said in-built function, but I can't think of an expressive way of building an algorithm like this
A link to the book would be helpful
PS. I understand the code should know beforehand the amount of rooms and their connection to each other, but just to clear steps in the algorithm we should be able to add new rooms and re-arrange exsisting ones. (a point at which I might find it easy to just iterate the String)
https://www.nostarch.

nonteleShortcut.parsed_response:
For example the user inputs "1,2,3"
The answer would be: 1,2,3,2,6,23,8,14,13,11,2122,14,23,12,23,35,41
The AI will store the information inside a String variable that can change but the user should detect that when they find a new room that wasn't in the previous String they should take the string back, please avoid iterating an infinite number of times.
I know something like this could be made via brute force but I am here to see if it could be done eloquently "the pythonic" way and if possible putting it back to the user. Afaik is there no said in-built function, but I can't think of an expressive way of building an algorithm like this
A link to the book would be helpful
